try and work together cooperatively (as "us" rather than "we"
and "they") within the general framework of a network and trade
association. As some of the earnests of this cooperative approach
the Center has offered to:
1. Invited the NAEB President to become an ex-officio
member of the Affiliates Committee and attend all meetings of the
Committee and general meetings of Affiliates.
2. Invite NAEB Board to attend Affiliates Managers-Program
Directors meeting, Milwaukee,March 13-14 and to co-host a dinner
honoring FAE President Scott Fletcher,
3. To take out network membership in NAEB (fee probably
$1,500) and, possibly, for all members of their professional staff
to take out individual memberships in NAEB.
4. To entertain proposals for underwriting certain training
proejcts to be conduc ted by NAEB.
5. Consider possibility of making all BFA offerings part of
NAEB Network package.
6. Invite NAEB President to attend meeting of the Center
Boards Legislative Committee, Washington, February 15.
In turn, NAEB offered to:
1. Invite the Center to participate in planning 3rd Alletton
House Seminar on the role of NAEB and consider advisability or
it the role of NAEB-NETRC, i.e., functions and relation¬
ships of educational broadcasting’s two operating agencies.
